title: Love Island's Amber Gill rules out romantic reunion with ex Greg O'Shea
text:
Get the biggest Daily Love Island stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Love Island's Amber Gill has no plans to ever date her former beau Greg O'Shea again.

The confident beauty, 22, who won the 2019 series of the ITV romance with rugby player Greg - who shesplit the £50,000 winnings with - is not interested in being romantically involved with the Irish man after he dumped her via text.

When asked about her ex, the sassy star jibbed: "Um… who? I don’t know who you’re talking about!" according to MailOnline.

The former beauty salon worker the continued: "No I’m joking, I don’t keep in contact with him. I don’t think [rekindling] the romance is on the cards."

Amber also shared that she is too busy with her work schedule to focus on love at the moment, as she candidly told: "'People think my DMs are poppin’ off but there absolutely not! I wish they were! To be honest, I haven’t really got time to be dating anyone, I’m happy with all the work I’ve got going on."

(Image: Instagram)

The Geordie native has not been shy in admitting she is less than fond of her ex Greg since their brief romance ended.

Last month, the curvy star made a savage dig at her former flame as she enjoyed a girls' night out with co-star Yewande Biala.

As the girls attended a launch event for Ariana Grande's Thank U, Next fragrance in London, Amber appeared to send a message to Greg as she signed a guest book.

Yewande filmed her as she wrote on a page underneath a sticker that referenced the song lyrics "one taught me patience".

(Image: REX)

Amber wrote "One taught me nothing", underlining that final word.

She added "Thank U, Next" before signing her name.

Amber's message appears to be a dig at her short-lived romance with Greg.

Opening up about the split on Loose Women, Amber said she hadn't seen it coming.

She told the panel: "Obviously I'm really disappointed, I wasn't expecting it at all.

(Image: amberrosegill/Instagram)

(Image: Phil Lewis / SplashNews.com)

"I was due just that weekend just gone to fly out to Dublin and spend the weekend with him and we were going on a TV show together and on that day I had to cancel because it wasn't working out.

"But yeah, I just think, you know the career and the distance was always a factor, it was always something that we knew about so I don't know what changed. I wanted to make it work but it is what it is really."

After being asked if she was disappointed in the situation or Greg himself, she added: "A little bit of both.

"I am disappointed that it's over but, you know, I'm booked and I'm busy. I'll be fine, onwards and upwards from here."

description: The star, who was dumped by her Love Island beau after 39 days together, is not interested in dating the rugby player again
